decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly cycling through your deck to trigger powerful effects from cards like Zenith Flare and Improbable Alliance. By cycling through cards like Flourishing Fox and Drannith Stinger, you can quickly build up a board presence and deal damage to your opponent. The deck also includes cards like Valiant Rescuer and Boon of the Wish-Giver to generate tokens and draw cards, maintaining pressure on your opponent. Overall, the key strategy is to cycle through your deck efficiently while dealing damage to your opponent.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and enchantments to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The win condition comes from generating value through cards like Dance of the Manse and Archon of Sun's Grace, while also utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to blink permanents for additional value. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana, allowing for flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and slowly grind out a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Lovestruck Beast, Bonecrusher Giant, Goldspan Dragon, and Brazen Borrower. By utilizing the synergy between creatures and spells, the deck aims to control the board and pressure the opponent quickly. With a mix of removal spells like Fire Prophecy and counterspells like Saw It Coming, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong offense. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to all colors needed for the cards in the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly swarm the board with low-cost, efficient creatures to overwhelm the opponent. By leveraging the synergy between cards like Skyclave Apparition, Selfless Savior, and Luminarch Aspirant, the deck aims to maintain board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy with removal spells. Key creatures like Usher of the Fallen and Seasoned Hallowblade can also provide additional value through their abilities. Additionally, cards like Shadowspear and Maul of the Skyclaves can help boost the deck's aggression and provide additional utility in combat situations.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with powerful, low-cost creatures in order to deal damage as fast as possible. The focus is on playing aggressive creatures like Questing Beast and Lovestruck Beast early in the game, backed up by powerful spells like Primal Might and The Great Henge to further boost your board presence. Key cards like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Gemrazer provide additional threats and disruption to control decks. The Snow-Covered Forest lands and Faceless Haven provide mana consistency and flexibility for your aggro strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and pump spells while generating card advantage with Edgewall Innkeeper. Utilizing the Companion mechanic with Jegantha to ensure consistency and provide additional flexibility. The deck aims to maintain a strong board presence and pressure the opponent, while also having access to powerful removal and interaction spells like Kabira Takedown and Giant Killer. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the three colors of Naya (Red, White, Green) while also providing flexibility with Fabled Passage and the Pathway lands.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the power of ramp and high-value creature cards to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By focusing on strong aggressive creatures like Goldspan Dragon and Bonecrusher Giant, as well as utilizing Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion for increased damage potential, the deck aims to put constant pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Edgewall Innkeeper help to generate card advantage and maintain board presence, while counter spells like Saw It Coming and Mystical Dispute provide protection and disruption against the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on playing large creatures quickly and efficiently, using cards like Goldspan Dragon and Lovestruck Beast to deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes counter spells like Saw It Coming and Alrund's Epiphany to control the board and protect your creatures. The inclusion of the companion Obosh, the Preypiercer adds additional damage to each odd-costed spell you play. The mana base includes a variety of pathways and triomes to ensure consistent mana production. Overall, this deck is built for aggressive play and quick victories.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, enchantments, and creatures that generate value. By utilizing cards like Doom Foretold and Extinction Event, along with counterspells like Negate, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining a board presence with cards like Archon of Sun's Grace. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents like Omen of the Sea and Omen of the Sun. The mana base is built to support the deck's colors and ensure consistent casting of spells.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategies and graveyard while milling their deck with Ruin Crab. By utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage from Into the Story, the deck aims to out-value the opponent and win the game through attrition. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing you to recast low-cost permanents from the graveyard. With a mix of disruption, mill, and card advantage, this Dimir Control deck aims to control the board and win through incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to trigger abilities that deal damage or create tokens. By cycling through the deck efficiently, players can build up a board presence and overwhelm their opponent with aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. Key cards like Zenith Flare and Improbable Alliance provide powerful finishers, while cards like Rielle, the Everwise and Drannith Stinger help players draw more cards and apply constant pressure. Overall, this deck aims to outpace opponents with its cycling abilities and aggressive playstyle.

The main concept of the deck is to generate value through a mix of aggressive creatures and card draw engines, while also utilizing the new Companion mechanic with Jegantha, the Wellspring. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Giant Killer, alongside powerful card advantage engines like Edgewall Innkeeper and Toski, Bearer of Secrets. The deck also includes finishers like Felidar Retreat and Showdown of the Skalds to close out games quickly. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast, consistent stream of threats.

This deck relies on fast and aggressive creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent, with a focus on dealing damage through red spells and abilities. By utilizing the synergy between cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Embercleave, it aims to end the game swiftly before the opponent can mount a strong defense. The inclusion of snow-covered lands also enables the use of Frost Bite for additional removal options. Overall, the deck is designed to apply continuous pressure and close out games efficiently.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming your opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful damage-dealing spells. It combines efficient creatures like Anax and Robber of the Rich with powerful finishers like Embercleave to close out games quickly. The inclusion of Snow-Covered Mountains and Faceless Haven provides additional flexibility and resilience. Torbran, Thane of Red Fell boosts all of your damage-dealing spells, while cards like Rimrock Knight and Fireblade Charger help maintain aggression throughout the game. Overall, this deck aims to win fast and decisively through relentless attacks and burn spells.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells. By utilizing creatures with haste and direct damage effects, the deck aims to apply pressure early in the game and maintain that pressure throughout. Cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Embercleave serve to boost the power of the creatures in play, making them even more threatening. The deck also includes some snow-covered lands and Faceless Haven for added versatility and potential evasion. Overall, this deck aims to win quickly and decisively through aggressive tactics.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells, counterspells, and powerful card advantage engines. The goal is to survive the early game with efficient removal and disruption, then ramp into powerful threats like Emergent Ultimatum and Yorion, Sky Nomad. The deck also includes versatile cards like Binding the Old Gods and Sea Gate Restoration to deal with a variety of threats. By generating card advantage and out-valuing the opponent, the deck aims to grind out a win through attrition and overwhelming the opponent with its powerful late-game threats.
